description:
Great note tacking application:
- Good amount of features without being to complex
- End to end encrypted
- Available across all platforms.

Looking forward to the integration into the Proton ecosystem!
Use it in the browser. Great to have a desktop version.
summary: Works great and is up to date. Thanks

description: The description maybe should mention if this is proprietary, require an online commercial account etc or is it self hosted? It mentions as being not affiliated with a commercial company, so has me wondering. Like to know before installing.
summary: Does this require an online account?

description:
Lovely, got it syncing between my android phone and linux fedora
A perfect note taking app

The various simple editors, simple themes, and encrypted notes are awesome. This could use a better interface for mobile, and handheld devices. But I'm sold on the tag-based structure that it follows. Keep up the good work.
Thought it was free but then it offered me a "premium subscription"?? no thx
A Very Secure, simple, open source app, that you can use on almost any OS

Positives
- it's a privacy respecting note taking app which is secure (I didn't personally check, where and how do they store your data?)
- it offers multiple ways to backup your notes automatically
- you can choose multiple text editors (rich text, markdown, spreadsheet, check list boxes)
- you can organise your notes with nesting
- the UI recently improved, it also feels uncluttered

Negatives
- the free version doesn't have text editors or nesting, you gotta fork $60/year at minimum to get these
- the rich text editors are frustrating when using. They are full of oddities (default line spacing / no possibility to set up a default, only one level of bullet point, copy pasting from another app seems to break formatting, slight lag when you type, ... the list goes on)
- the check list editor is fairly basic, you can't move tasks up and down, you can't use a simple cut and paste either, ...

I want to love this app, but every time I check it, I get frustrated with it after a few minutes.
I wish there was an Apple Note like app within the open source ecosystem, I'd be willing to pay for it if the price is right. I like the simplicity of Apple Notes. I could have convinced myself to pay for Standard Notes if the UX was not so buggy.

Standard Notes is an amazing notetaking app. I have been using it for over an year and still use it. However, I feel that the paid plan is too expensive and I will not be using it. The features you get in the free version are good but it is very limiting. However, the transparency is huge and led to my verdict being 4 stars.
It works, but it signs you out every time you exit the app. Just make a webapp, then it'll remember who you are.
Outrageously expensive subscription. Very limited free version. Self-hosting seems to be a huge headache, or at least too much of a headache for most.
Es multiplataforma y se sincroniza muy bien. La opción grátis es suficiente, pero podría mejorar.
